#Text=Swellendam
#Text=Swellendam ( pop . 35.000 ) is in the Western Cape region of South Africa .
#Text=It 's one of the oldest European settlements in South Africa and offers some fine examples of Dutch-Cape architecture .
#Text=The tourist office is in the old mission at Voortrek Street ( M - F 9AM to 5PM ) .
#Text=- Local area code : 028 ; Postcode 6740
#Text=By car
#Text=It will take about 2-3 hours on the N2 to reach Swellendam by car from Cape Town ( 240km ) .
#Text=By bus
#Text=The major companies serve Swellendam on their run from Cape Town to the Garden route but the service isn`t very extensive .
#Text=Swellendam is also served by the Baz Bus on its way from Cape Town to Port Elizabeth .
#Text=By air or train
#Text=There is no airport or train at Swellendam .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The town is so small that it 's best viewed while walking through the streets .
#Text=There is no public transport in the town except for the minibuses .
#Text=The minibus stand is on Voortrek street behind the SPAR supermarket .
#Text=See
#Text=The Drostdy :
#Text=the former magistrate 's seat was built in 1747 and now houses a museum .
#Text=It is a fine example of Cape-Dutch architecture .
#Text=Bontebok National Park : A few kilometres out of town , this park offers nice scenery .
#Text=Worth a day of hiking and a viewing of the flora and fauna .
#Text=De Hoop Nature Reserve : Beautiful little reserve , perfect for spotting whales !
#Text=Marloth Nature Reserve : On the southern slopes of the Langeberg Mountains offers an abundance of wild flowers and fynbos , as well as some hiking trails .
#Text=Do
#Text=Visit the museum and then go for Bontebok National Park .
#Text=For those with more time hiking in the Marloth nature reserve is worth a thought .
#Text=Fynbus Tours , 23 Swellengrebel St ( Bontebok Tourist Centre , opposite Drostdy Museum Shop ) , ☏ +2783 621-8503 .
#Text=Guided Tours from Swellendam : game viewing , birding and bush walks at Bontebok National Park , whale-watching ( June to November ) at the De Hoop Nature Reserve .
#Text=Wine tasting and exclusive winemaker tours at wine estates .
#Text=Adventure sports , arts and culture , tailored personal tours & airport transfers available on request .
#Text=Professional field guide & luxury air-conditioned vehicle .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Several restaurants line the main street .
#Text=Mattsen 's Steakhouse , 44 Voortrek St. Popular for its steaks , pasta and pizzas .
#Text=Powell House Restaurant , 113A Voortrek St.

#Text=Located in an old building , this restaurant features traditional South African dishes , such as curries and boboties , prepared with attention to detail , and a friendly host who will help make the evening enjoyable .
#Text=It 's a quiet place , and in the low season you might be the only patrons , but the food is good , the ambiance is nice , and the host is guaranteed to make the visit worthwhile .
#Text=Drink
#Text=The Old Mill , 241 Voortrek Str , ☏ +2728 514-2790 .
#Text=Traditional South African cooking served in warm , rustic surroundings .
#Text=Lovely , large patio area under vines for warm , balmy summer evenings .
#Text=Great food , great atmosphere and friendly staff .
#Text=Mid-range
#Text=African Shades Guesthouse , 11-13 Swellengrebelstreet , ☏ +2728 514-2944 , ✉ info@africanshades.co.za . R295 - R380pps .
#Text=Braeside Bed & Breakfast , 13 Van Oudtshoornweg , ☏ +2728 514-3325 , ✉ info@braeside.co.za .
#Text=A very nice Cape Edwardian building , enjoy the breakfast on the terrace .
#Text=From R250 pps .
#Text=Heerden Huijs , 5 Swellengrebel St , ☏ +2728 514-2841 , ✉ info@heerdenhuijs.co.za .
#Text=Situated in the heart of Swellendam , offer the essence of hospitality .
#Text=Although situated on the main road , the rooms are quiet and cool .
#Text=Within walking distance of the historical sites and restaurants .
#Text=Enjoy a scruptious breakfast either in the dining room or on the patio besides the pool .
#Text=Dinner/braai ( barbeque ) by prior arrangement .
#Text=Rates are R275pps , single on request. .
#Text=Swellendam Backpackers Adventure Lodge , 5 Lichtenstein St , ☏ +2728 514-2648 , ✉ info@swellendambackpackers.co.za .
#Text=Offers adventure and accommodation .
#Text=Camping with own tent R50pp , safari tent R100pp .
#Text=Dormbed R100pp , double room , standard and ensuite R350 and selfcatering cottage from R400. .
#Text=Swellendam Country Lodge Guest House B&B , 237 Voortrek St , ☏ +2728 514-3629 , ✉ info@swellendamlodge.com .
#Text=4 stars ( Tourism Grading Council of South Africa ) .
#Text=The guest house has a unique atmosphere , the stylish characteristic interior is a combination of classic charm and modern style .
#Text=The rooms are situated in a beautiful landscaped garden where you will enjoy the wide range of birds , trees , fruit and flowers .
#Text=On warm summer days , the large sparkling swimming pool is a refreshment not to be missed .
#Text=Off street parking .
#Text=English , Afrikaans , German , Dutch spoken .
#Text=From R360pps .
#Text=Splurge
#Text=Bloomestate Luxury Retreat Guesthouse , 276 Voortrek St , ☏ +2728 514-2984 , ✉ info@bloomestate.com .
#Text=For lovers of style , modern design , beautiful surroundings and the finer things in life , Bloomestate will be your retreat of choice .
#Text=On an estate of 2.5 ha , this guesthouse has seven stylish modern gardenrooms with large bathrooms .
#Text=French doors open onto landscaped gardens with a tranguil dam , heated saltwater pool and mountain views .
#Text=With a maximum of 14 guests , privacy , attentive service and supreme comfort are assured .
#Text=The perfect hideaway to relax and unwind .
#Text=Lounge area with open air Jacuzzi , conference facilities in the lounge .
#Text=Stroll to restaurants , small platters on request .
#Text=Wine estates and nature reserves nearby .
#Text=From R575pps .
#Text=Go next
#Text=The rest of the Overberg .
